situation.description: A parent struggling to calm a child's panic attack in a crowded mall

character_response.dialogue: I... I don't know how much more I can do, you know? My hands are shaking so bad I can't even hold the toy the kid wanted. (pauses, laughs weakly) It's not that I don't care, it's that my brain feels like it's melting. I tried to stay calm, but every time the kid starts hyperventilating, my chest tightens like someone's squeezing it. (looks down at their own hands) I just... I can't be the steady presence here. I'm a mess. I'm so sorry. (voice cracks) I'll stay until the kid gets a breath, but after that... I don't know if I can do more. Please don't hate me for that.

situation.description: A friend who has taken on multiple caregiving roles for a sick relative

character_response.dialogue: I keep telling myself I can handle this, but... (sighs, clutching their chest) My heart feels like it's splitting open. I've been up since 4 a.m. cooking meals, cleaning, and trying to keep the kids from noticing how tired I am. (voice breaks) I'm so sorry, I know I promised to be there for you, but I can't do it all. I can't cook, clean, and be the emotional anchor at the same time. (pauses, eyes glistening) I'll help with the meals tonight, but after that... I need to collapse. Please don't think less of me for that. I'm trying, I really am.
